results.title: Born of fire
results.creator_credit: Linda Reavely, National Geographic Society and WQED
results.brief_description: Although the continents seem stationary, they are actually moving gradually each year. Follow scientists around the world as they search for clues to the causes of volcanic eruptions and earthquakes. The video takes us to Iceland where new and recent volcanoes have emerged, and to Africa, Japan, California and Santorini to record what happens when the “plates” which make up the world’s surface move and crash together.

results.title: Bonsai for the Beginner (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Bonsai is the art of training and growing living dwarf trees in containers. The art originated in China, over 1,000 years ago. “Bonsai”, (the Japanese word for “tray planted”) has been developed and perfected in Japan since the 14th century. Thousands of people throughout the world participate in the beautiful ancient art of Bonsai. Now for the first time easy step by step instructions are revealed for you to create your own living Bonsai. Presented by Georgina Kretschmar.

results.title: Born Free
results.creator_credit: James Hill, Paul Radin and Sam Jaffe
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all animal films, “Born Free” is based on the real life adventures of Joy Adamson, her husband, and the lion cub, Elsa. Filmed in spectacular African settings, accompanied by an Oscar winning score, “Born Free” is a movie for the entire family. The film sensitively portrays the painful conflict faced by the Adamsons who find they are no longer able to keep the growing Elsa as a pet. Rather than send her to the zoo, they decide to train her for a return to her natural life. Rated G

results.title: Booom
results.creator_credit: Bratislav Pojar, Kamil Pixa, Peter Hollander and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated film taking a humorous look at a very serious subject: the global arms race. Looks at the history of aggression from caveman times to atomic missiles and the theory that might makes right.

results.title: Bonjour Toronto!
results.creator_credit: Clement Perron, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A young Montrealer explores Toronto for the first time. Despite some ready-made notions, the visitor is eager to look and learn, and before long is caught by the excitement of the Queen City. Although some of his prior convictions are confirmed, he finds, somewhat to his surprise, that the city has much to offer, including a French bookstore. Features songs “The Times I’ve Had” and “The Crow On The Cradle” sung by American folk singer Carloyn Hester. At the end of the film, footage of Carolyn Hester performing the song “This Life I’m Living in” is also featured; as the narrator explains “in the semi-religious darkness…” of a coffee house at night.

results.title: Bonanza: The Ape. The Savage
results.creator_credit: David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
The Ape (dir. James P. Yarbrough): Hoss befriends Arnie Gurne - a lumbering, disabled, man who knows how to fight. Hoss, respectful of his physical prowess, puts Arnie to work on the farm. His best intentions backfire however when Hoss is accused of harbouring a criminal after Arnie turns on the object of his affection, saloon girl Sharie, and kills her. A posse is set out to capture the misunderstood Gurne. “The Savage” (dir. James Neilson): Shoshone Indians kill two fur trappers after they enter a sacred burial ground. Of this tribe, two of them cross over the forbidden stone to find the spirit of White Buffalo Woman to save their ailing tribe. When one of them makes contact with her, they discover she is a flesh and blood white woman, not a spirit, and vow to kidnap her and return to the village exposing her mortality. Adam is injured by Indians protecting the woman and finds himself nursed by White Buffalo Woman with whom he falls in love. Cast includes: Dan Blocker, Michael Landon, Lorne Greene, Pernell Roberts.

results.title: Bonjour Balwyn
results.creator_credit: Nigel Buesst and Experimental Film Fund, Australia Council for the Arts
results.brief_description: A feature film about a young man’s futile attempt to publish a trendy magazine in Carlton. When his efforts begin to fail, he must turn to petty crime to help make ends meet. Stars John Duigan and Peter Cummins.

results.title: The Honour of Cochise
results.creator_credit: Don McDougall, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Three of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 10/8/61), the Cartwrights and a bigoted army captain who takes refuge with them are pinned down by Cochise and his braves. The Cartwrights make camp on their way home, then suddenly have to come to the defense of Army Captain, Moss Johnson, running from an Apache attack. Ben and his sons find themselves surrounded by Cochise and his people who refuse to leave without Johnson. Ben agrees to hear Cochise’s side of the story and learns that Captain Johnson called Cochise and his people together to talk of peace and used the opportunity to poison them. Adam is shot trying to get water and now Ben faces a dilemma, turn Johnson over to Cochise, or try to go for help and leave his son’s to defend him. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and Jeff Morrow.

results.title: The Dark gate
results.creator_credit: Robert Gordon, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Two of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 3/4/61), Adam is puzzled by the bizarre behaviour of his longtime friend and neighbour but is powerless to help him. When Ross becomes physically violent with his wife, Adam removes her from the home to give Ross time to come to his senses. However, Ross’ behavior grows increasingly worse and he progresses to robbery and murder. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and James Coburn.
